entries.value: Universal Credit is a welfare benefit introduced in the United Kingdom in 2013 to replace six means-tested benefits and tax credits: income based Jobseeker's Allowance, Housing Benefit, Working Tax Credit, Child Tax Credit, income based Employment and Support Allowance and Income Support.
synonyms: Universal Credit is a welfare benefit introduced in the United Kingdom in 2013 to replace six means-tested benefits and tax credits: income based Jobseeker's Allowance, Housing Benefit, Working Tax Credit, Child Tax Credit, income based Employment and Support Allowance and Income Support.

entries.value: You may be able to claim Universal Credit if you’re on a low income or out of work. You don’t need to do anything if you’re already claiming other benefits.
synonyms: You may be able to claim Universal Credit if you’re on a low income or out of work. You don’t need to do anything if you’re already claiming other benefits.
